description:
Commodity Managers work with Engineering teams to make sure Google has the supplies and equipment to put into production the innovative products coming from our Engineering teams. As a Commodity Manager, you use your wide industry knowledge and strategic supplier relationships to optimize our total cost of ownership for our global -- and growing -- infrastructure. The scale at which Google operates means that savings on just one piece of hardware can have a huge impact on Google's bottom line.

As a Commodity Manager, you will be responsible for all aspects of supplier development and ongoing performance management to Google's technology and business needs. You'll develop and execute Google's sourcing strategy for all of our Processors and Computing hardware, in support of our infrastructure deployment that powers all of Google's services. Additionally, you will lead and participate on large projects and understand and resolve complex challenges. You will be a key part of an end-to-end supply chain team that drives continuous improvement and ensures operational excellence in support of Google's rapid growth.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We're always on call to keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 7 years of experience managing semiconductors or computing hardware supply chain.
  • Experience with agreement negotiations.

Preferred qualifications:

  • MBA or Master's degree in Electrical Engineering other relevant science.
  • 10 years of experience managing microprocessors/GPUs or computing hardware supply chain.
responsibilities:
• Develop long-term, sourcing strategies for processors and computing hardware (e.g., Microprocessors, Graphics, etc). Manage supplier relationships and performance in technology alignment, cost, quality, and delivery.
  • Implement supply chain improvements.
  • Lead cross-functional teams through robust supplier selection for new platforms.
  • Oversee high-level business agreements and secure comprehensive agreements with supplier executives.
  • Maintain a high level of industry knowledge and keep stakeholders aware of supplier/market conditions.
title: Commodity Manager, Processors
